Look away from me, so I can smile again
before I depart and am no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I waited and waited for the Lord.
Then he turned to me and heard my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he pulled me up from the deadly quicksand,
from the mud and muck.
He made my feet stand on a rock to keep my steps from slipping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he put a new song in my mouth,
a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear.
They will trust in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is everyone who trusts in the Lord,
who does not look to the proud
or to those who turn aside to falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many are the wonders you have done, O Lord my God.
No one can explain to you all your thoughts for us.
If I try to speak and tell about them,
they are too many to count.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice and offering you did not desire.
Ears you have opened for me.
You did not ask for burnt offerings and sin offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “Here I am, I have come.
The book written on a scroll tells about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, I take pleasure in doing your will.
Your law is in my heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I preach righteousness in the great assembly.
Indeed, I do not hold back my lips, O Lord, as you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I do not conceal your righteousness deep in my heart.
I speak of your faithfulness and salvation.
I do not hide your mercy and your truth from the great assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you do not hold back your compassion from me.
Let your mercy and your truth always protect me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
although troubles without number surround me.
Punishments for my guilt have smothered me, so I cannot see.
They are more than the hairs of my head, so my courage deserts me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be pleased, O Lord, to save me.
Lord, hurry to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let all who seek to end my life be frustrated and completely confused.
Let everyone who desires my ruin be turned back and disgraced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who say to me, “Aha! We got you!” be dismayed,
because they have been put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
Let those who love your salvation always say,
“The Lord is great!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am poor and needy.
May the Lord think about me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O my God, do not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the person who understands the plight of the weak!
May the Lord deliver him in the day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord guard him and keep him alive.
May he be blessed in the land.
May you not surrender him to the desire of his enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord sustain him on his sickbed.
You raise him up from his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “Lord, have mercy on me.
Heal my soul, for I have sinned against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My enemies speak evil about me:
“When will he die and his name perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one comes to see me, he speaks falsely.
In his heart he collects malicious plans.
He goes out. He speaks about them in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who hate me whisper together against me.
They plan evil for me. They say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A deadly affliction is poured out on him.
He will never get up from the place where he lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a man who was at peace with me,
a man whom I trusted, who ate my bread,
    has raised up his heel to step on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, have mercy on me.
Raise me up, so that I can repay them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From this I know that you are pleased with me:
My enemy does not triumph over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me—in my integrity you uphold me,
and you set me up in your presence forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. A maskil by the Sons of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a doe pants for streams of water,
so my soul pants for you, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God.
When can I go and appear before God?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am overcome by my emotions
whenever I remember these things:
    how I used to arrive with the crowd,
    as I led the procession to the house of God,
    with loud shouts of thanksgiving,
    with the crowd celebrating the festival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for salvation from his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, my soul is depressed within me.
Therefore I will remember you from the land of the Jordan,
from the heights of Hermon, from Mount Mizar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deep calls to deep in the roar of your rapids.
All your breakers and your waves have swept over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By day the Lord commands his mercy,
and at night his song is with me—a prayer to the God of my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to God my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I go around mourning because of oppression by the enemy?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is like breaking my bones when my foes taunt me.
All day long they say to me, “Where is your God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for my salvation from the face of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judge me justly, O God,
and plead my case against an ungodly nation.
Rescue me from the deceitful, wicked man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know you are God, my stronghold.
Why have you rejected me?
Why must I go around mourning
    because of oppression by the enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Send out your light and your truth.
Let them guide me.
Let them bring me to your holy mountain,
to your dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will go to the altar of God,
to God, my joy and gladness.
Then I will praise you with the lyre, O God, my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you so depressed, O my soul?
Why so disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I will again praise him
    for my salvation from the face of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, our ears have heard.
Our fathers have told us the work you performed
    in their days, in days long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your hand you drove out the nations,
but you planted your people.
You crushed the peoples,
but you sent your people forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it was not by their sword
    that they took possession of the land.
It was not their arm that saved them.
It was your right hand and your arm,
and the light from your face,
because you took pleasure in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the one who is my King, O God.
Command victories for Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through you we drive back our foes.
Through your name we trample our adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I do not trust in my bow,
and my sword does not save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you save us from our foes,
and you put those who hate us to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God we make our boast all day,
and we will praise your name forever. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now you have rejected and humbled us,
and you do not go out with our armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made us turn back before the foe,
and those who hate us have taken plunder for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give us up for food like sheep,
and you have scattered us among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sold your people for no great price,
and you have not profited from their sale.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a reproach to our neighbors,
scorn and ridicule to those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us a laughingstock among the nations,
a reason for the peoples to shake their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day my disgrace is right in front of me,
and the shame on my face covers me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of the voice of the slanderer and reviler,
because of the enemy and avenger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All this came on us, though we had not forgotten you.
We had not been false to your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our hearts had not turned back.
Our steps had not slipped off your path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you crushed us and made us a home for jackals,
and you covered us with the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
or spread out our hands to a foreign god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
would not God have discovered this,
since he knows the secrets of the heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet for your sake we are killed all day long.
We are considered sheep to be slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Get up! Why do you sleep, O Lord? Wake up!
Do not reject us forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hide your face?
Why do you forget our misery and our oppression?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For our souls bow down to the dust.
Our bellies cling to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stand up! Help us!
Redeem us because of your mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the choir director. According to “Lilies.”
By the Sons of Korah. A maskil. A love song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is bubbling over with a beautiful theme.
I am reciting my works for the King.
My tongue is the pen of a rapid writer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the most beautiful of the sons of Adam.
Grace is poured out on your lips.
Therefore God has blessed you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strap your sword on your thigh, you mighty warrior,
    in your splendor and your majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your majesty advance successfully.
Ride forward in the cause of truth, humility, and righteousness.
Let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your arrows are sharpened.
Let peoples fall beneath you.
Your arrows are in the heart of the king’s enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever.
The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness.
Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy
    more than any of your companions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Myrrh, aloes, and cassia perfume all your garments.
From ivory palaces stringed instruments make you glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Daughters of kings are among your honored attendants.
The royal wife stands at your right hand in gold from Ophir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O daughter, look and listen.
Forget your people and your father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the king desires your beauty.
Because he is your lord, bow down to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift.
The richest people will seek your favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princess, who waits inside, is all glorious.
Her dress is interwoven with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In embroidered garments she is led to the king.
Virgins who follow her as attendants are brought to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are brought with joyful celebration.
They enter the palace of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your sons will take the place of your fathers.
You will make them princes in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will preserve the memory of your name through all generations.
Therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is our refuge and strength,
a helper who can always be found in times of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why we will not fear when the earth dissolves
and when the mountains tumble into the heart of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its waters roar and foam.
The mountains quake when it rises. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a river—its streams bring joy to the city of God,
to the holy dwelling of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in her. She will not fall.
God will help her at daybreak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nations are in turmoil. Kingdoms fall.
God raises his voice. The earth melts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of Armies is with us.
The God of Jacob is a fortress for us. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, look at the works of the Lord.
What a wasteland he has made of the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes wars cease to the end of the earth.
He shatters the bow. He cuts up the spear.
He burns the carts with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Be still, and know that I am God.
I will be exalted among the nations.
I will be exalted on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of Armies is with us.
The God of Jacob is a fortress for us. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All you peoples, clap your hands!
Shout to God! Sing a loud song!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the Lord Most High is awesome.
He is the great King over all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He subdues peoples under us
and nations under our feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He chooses our inheritance for us.
It is the pride of Jacob, whom he loves. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has ascended with a joyful shout.
The Lord goes up with the sound of the ram’s horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make music for God! Make music!
Make music for our King! Make music!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God is the King of all the earth.
Make music for him with a wise song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God reigns as king over the nations.
God is seated on his holy throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nobles of the peoples come together
    as the people of the God of Abraham.
Yes, the shields of the earth belong to God.
He is greatly exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is great. He deserves to be praised
    in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His mountain is lofty and beautiful, the joy of the whole earth.
Mount Zion, the northern mountain, is the city of the Great King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is in her citadels.
He is famous as her fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! See! The kings came together.
They advanced together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They saw. Yes, they were amazed.
They were terrified. They were put to flight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trembling seized them there,
pain like a woman giving birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shattered them with an east wind, like ships of Tarshish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What we have heard, we now have also seen:
    In the city of the Lord of Armies,
    in the city of our God, Interlude
    God establishes her forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside your temple, O God, we meditate on your mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your praise, O God, reaches to the ends of the earth,
just as your fame does.
Righteousness fills your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mount Zion rejoices.
The daughters of Judah celebrate because of your judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go around Zion. Yes, go all the way around her.
Count her towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consider her rampart.
View her citadels, so that you may tell the next generation about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this God is our God forever and ever.
He will guide us beyond death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, all you peoples.
Pay attention, all you inhabitants of this world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all you children of Adam, all mankind,
rich and poor alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will speak wisdom.
The meditation of my heart will give understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will listen carefully to wise teaching.
With a lyre I will explain deep truths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I fear days of trouble,
days when the wickedness of my pursuers surrounds me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They trust in their wealth.
They place their confidence in the abundance of their riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But no one can by any means redeem himself.
He cannot give God a ransom for himself—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Yes, the ransom for their souls is costly.
Any payment would fall short.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: —so that he could live on forever and not see the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, we can see that wise men die.
The fool and the senseless alike perish,
and they leave their wealth to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They think their houses will remain forever,
their dwellings for generation after generation
because they named lands after themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But man, though he has riches, does not even spend a night here.
He is like the animals that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This way of theirs is foolishness,
but their followers approve of what they say. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a flock destined for the grave.
Death will be their shepherd.
The upright will rule over them in the morning.
Their bodies will be consumed by the grave,
    far from their mansions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But surely God will redeem my life from the power of the grave.
Yes, he will take me to himself. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid when a man grows rich,
when the glory of his house increases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because when he dies, he cannot take anything along.
His glory will not go down with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Throughout his life he congratulates himself:
“People praise you because you have done so well for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will go to the gathering place of his fathers.
They will never see the light!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who has riches but does not understand
    is like the animals that perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A psalm by Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, God the Lord, has spoken.
He calls to the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God comes and he will not be silent.
Fire devours in front of him.
Around him a storm rages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He calls to the heavens above and to the earth
    to judge his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Gather to me my favored ones,
who make a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the heavens proclaim his righteousness,
    because God himself is judge. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my people, and let me speak, O Israel.
Then I will testify against you:
I am God, your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not because of your sacrifices that I rebuke you
or because of your burnt offerings that are always in front of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I do not need to take a bull from your barn
    or goats from your pens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because every animal in the forest is mine,
the cattle on a thousand mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know every bird in the mountains,
and everything that moves in the field is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
because the world is mine, and all that fills it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls,
or do I drink the blood of goats?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
and fulfill your vows to the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Call on me in the day of distress.
I will deliver you, and you will honor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to the wicked, God says:
What right do you have to recite my statutes
or to take up my covenant with your mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for you—you hate discipline,
and you throw my words behind your back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you see a thief, you approve of him,
and you cast your lot with adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You devote your mouth to evil,
and your tongue weaves deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sit and speak against your brother.
You slander your own mother’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These things you have done, and I kept silent.
You thought I was just like you.
I will indict you and accuse you to your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now consider this, you who forget God,
or I will tear you to pieces,
and there will be no one to rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who sacrifices a thank offering honors me,
and he sets up the way by which I will show him the salvation of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be gracious to me, God,
    according to your mercy.
Erase my acts of rebellion
    according to the greatness of your compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scrub me clean from my guilt.
Purify me from my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I admit my rebellious acts.
My sin is always in front of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against you, you only, have I sinned,
and I have done this evil in your eyes.
So you are justified when you sentence me.
You are blameless when you judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Certainly, I was guilty when I was born.
I was sinful when my mother conceived me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since you desire truth on the inside,
in my hidden heart you teach me wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove my sin with hyssop, and I will be clean.
Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me hear joy and gladness.
Let the bones you have crushed celebrate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide your face from my sins.
Erase all my guilty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Create in me a pure heart, O God.
Renew an unwavering spirit within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not cast me from your presence.
Do not take your Holy Spirit from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation.
Sustain me with a willing spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will teach rebels your ways,
and sinners will turn to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from bloodshed, O God,
    the God who saves me.
My tongue will shout for joy about your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will declare your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you do not delight in sacrifice,
or I would give it.
You do not take pleasure in burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifices God wants are a broken spirit.
A broken and crushed heart, O God, you will not despise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it pleases you, do good for Zion.
Build up the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will be pleased with righteous sacrifices,
    burnt offerings and whole offerings.
Then bulls will be offered up on your altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you boast about evil, you hero?
The mercy of God endures all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your tongue plans destruction.
It is like a sharpened razor, you scheming liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You love evil rather than good. Interlude
You love lying rather than speaking what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You lying tongue, you love every word that devours!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will tear you down forever.
He will grab you and pull you out of your tent. Interlude
He will uproot you from the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the righteous will see and fear.
Then they will laugh at him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look, here is the man who did not make God his stronghold,
but trusted in the greatness of his wealth.
He grew strong by his destructive deeds!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God.
I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will thank you forever because you have done this.
I will hope in your name in the presence of your favored ones
    because it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt. They commit horrible evil.
There is no one who does good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God looks down from heaven on all the children of Adam
    to see if there is anyone who understands,
    anyone who seeks God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every single one has turned back.
Altogether they have become rotten.
There is no one who does good.
There is not even one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t they know, all those evildoers,
    who devour my people as if they were eating bread?
They do not call on God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they are, terrified, where there was nothing to fear.
For God scattered the bones of those who camped against you.
You put them to shame, because God despised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will provide salvation for Israel from Zion?
When God restores his people, let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, save me by your name.
By your power judge me justly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, hear my prayer.
Turn your ear to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For strangers have risen up against me.
Ruthless men seek my life. Interlude
They pay no attention to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, God is my helper.
The Lord is the one who preserves my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let evil return on those who oppress me.
In your faithfulness destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sacrifice willingly to you.
I will praise your name, O Lord, because it is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, from all my distress he has delivered me.
My eyes have looked down on my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your ear to my prayer, O God.
Do not hide from my plea for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention to me and answer me.
I am troubled in my thoughts and I groan
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of talk from the enemy,
    because of oppression from the wicked,
    because they dump evil on me,
    and in anger they hold a grudge against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is in anguish within me.
The terrors of death fall on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear and trembling come over me.
Horror covers me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I say, “I wish I had wings like a dove!
I would fly away and find a place to rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I would flee far away. Interlude
I would stay in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would hurry to find shelter,
    far from the violent wind, far from the storm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Swallow them up, O Lord.
Confuse their speech,
for I see violence and contention in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Day and night they sneak around on its walls.
Evil and trouble are in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destruction lurks within it.
Treachery and deceit never leave its streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is not an enemy who insults me—
I could bear that.
It is not someone who hated me who rises up against me—
I could hide from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is you, a man who served with me,
    my colleague and my associate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with whom I shared pleasant discussions
    as we walked with the excited crowd at God’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let deadly destruction come on them.
Let them go down to the grave alive,
because evil is at home in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I call to God,
and the Lord saves me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evening, morning, and noon I cry out and I sigh,
and he hears my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In peace he redeems my life from the assault against me,
    even when many are against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will hear, and he will punish them— Interlude
yes, he is seated on his throne from eternity!
—because they never change, and they do not fear God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The traitor reaches out his hand against those at peace with him.
He breaks his agreement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His flattery is as smooth as butter,
yet war is in his heart.
His words are more soothing than oil,
yet they are drawn daggers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Place your burden on the Lord,
and he will support you.
He will never allow the righteous to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction.
Bloody and deceitful men will not live half their days.
But as for me, I will trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the choir director. “A Dove on Distant Oaks.”
By David. A miktam.
When the Philistines had seized him in Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be merciful to me, O God, for a man pants as he pursues me.
All day long an attacker presses against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who spy on me pant as they pursue me all day long.
Yes, many are attacking me boldly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day when I am afraid, I will trust in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God I praise his word.
In God I trust. I will not fear.
What can flesh do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long they hurt my cause.
All their thoughts against me are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They gather together. They hide.
They try to trip me by grabbing my heels
    while they wait to take my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of their wickedness do not let them escape.
In your anger bring down the peoples, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You keep a record of my tossing and turning.
Keep my tears in your bottle.
Aren’t they all listed in your book?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then my enemies will turn back on the day when I call.
This is how I will know that God is for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God I praise a word.
In the Lord I praise a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God I trust. I will not be afraid.
What can man do to me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My vows to you are binding, O God.
I will complete my thank offerings to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you have delivered my life from death.
Have you not delivered my feet from stumbling
    so I can walk before God in the light of life?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the choir director. “Do Not Destroy.” By David. A miktam.
When he fled from Saul. In the cave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O God,
have mercy on me,
because my soul has taken refuge in you.
In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge
    until destruction has passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to God Most High,
to God, who completes his plans for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will send from heaven, and he will save me. Interlude
He puts to shame the one who pants as he pursues me.
God will send his mercy and his faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My life is spent among lions.
I lie down among ferocious men,
whose teeth are spears and arrows,
whose tongue is a sharp sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
May your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spread a net for my steps.
My soul was bowed down.
They dug a pit in front of me. Interlude
They have fallen into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is steadfast, O God.
My heart is steadfast.
I will sing and I will make music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, my soul!
Awake, harp and lyre!
I will awaken the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give thanks to you among the peoples, O Lord.
I will make music to you among the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because your great mercy reaches above the heavens,
and your faithfulness to the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
Let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. “Do Not Destroy.” By David. A miktam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you “gods” really speak righteously?
Do you sons of Adam judge rightly?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, in your heart you commit injustices.
On the earth your hands distribute violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked go off course already from the womb.
From the belly they go astray. They speak lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their venom is like the venom of a snake,
like a deaf cobra that has stopped its ears,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that will not listen to the sound of the charmers,
however skillful the spellbinder may be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, break their teeth in their mouths.
Tear out the fangs of the young lions, Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them vanish like water that flows away.
When he draws his bow, let his arrows be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a slug melts away as it crawls along, so let him disappear.
Like a stillborn child may they not see the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns—
whether the thorns are green or dry—they will be swept away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous one will be glad when he sees vengeance.
He will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then people will say, “Surely there is fruit for the righteous.
Surely there is a God judging on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from my enemies, my God.
You set me high above those who rise up against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver me from evildoers.
Save me from bloodthirsty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, look how they lie in ambush to take my life!
Strong men gather against me,
but it is not because I have rebelled,
not because I have sinned, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am not guilty,
yet they run to take up their positions against me.
Rise up to meet me and see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, O Lord, God of Armies, the God of Israel,
wake up and confront all the nations. Interlude
Do not show mercy to all the wicked traitors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening. They growl like dogs.
They prowl around the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, they gush from their mouths.
Their lips are swords,
so they say, “Who hears?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you laugh at them, Lord.
You scoff at all those nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my Strength, I watch for you,
because God is my high fortress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My merciful God will go ahead of me.
God will make me look down on those who slander me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not kill them, or my people may forget.
In your might make them wander about.
Bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sin of their mouth is the words of their lips,
so let them be caught in their pride,
because of the curses and lies they proclaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consume them in wrath.
Consume them till they are no more.
Then they will know to the ends of the earth Interlude
    that God rules over Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return at evening. They growl like dogs.
They prowl around the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wander about for food.
If not satisfied, they howl.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will sing about your strength.
In the morning I will shout about your mercy,
because you are a high fortress for me,
a refuge in the day of my distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O my Strength, to you I make music,
because God is my high fortress, my merciful God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the choir director. “The Lily of Testimony.” A miktam by David.
For teaching. When he waged war against Aram Naharaim and against Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck down twelve thousand men of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, you have rejected us.
You have broken us down.
You have been angry. Return to us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have shaken the earth. You have torn it open.
Heal its fractures, for it is about to collapse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made your people suffer hardship.
You gave us wine to drink that makes us stagger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have set up a signal flag for those who fear you, Interlude
    to be raised up against the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us with your right hand and answer us,
so that those you love may be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has spoken in his holiness:
“I will triumph. I will distribute Shechem,
and I will measure off the Valley of Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine.
Ephraim is my helmet. Judah is my scepter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab is my washbasin. On Edom I toss my sandal.
I shout aloud over Philistia.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, is it not you, who have rejected us?
God, is it not you, who no longer go out with our armies?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give us help against the foe,
for human help is worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In God we will do mighty deeds.
He is the one who will trample our foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. On a stringed instrument. By David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my cry, O God.
Pay attention to my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the end of the earth I call to you
    when my heart is overwhelmed.
Lead me up onto the rock that is higher than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have been a refuge for me,
a tower of strength in the face of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I want to keep living in your tent forever. Interlude
I will take refuge under the cover of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, God, have heard my vows.
You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add days to the days of the king.
His years will last through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him be seated in God’s presence forever.
Appoint your mercy and truth to protect him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will I make music to your name forever,
    to fulfill my vows day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. According to Jeduthun. A psalm by David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul rests quietly in God alone.
My salvation is from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress.
I will not be disturbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you threaten a man?
Do all of you want to murder him,
    like a leaning wall, like a fence to be pushed down?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, they plan to push him down from his lofty place.
They are delighted with deceit.
With their mouths they bless,
but inside they curse. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul, rest quietly in God alone,
for my hope comes from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress.
I will not be disturbed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My salvation and my honor depend on God, my strong rock.
My refuge is in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in him at all times, you people.
Pour out your hearts before him. Interlude
God is a refuge for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the sons of Adam are only a breath.
The sons of man are a delusion.
On a scale they weigh nothing.
They are nothing but air.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not trust in extortion.
Do not put empty confidence in stolen goods.
If your wealth grows, do not set your heart on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One thing God has spoken,
two things that I have heard:
    that God has strength
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and that you, Lord, have mercy.
Surely you will repay each person
    according to what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A psalm by David. When he was in the wilderness of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, you are my God. Eagerly I seek you.
My soul thirsts for you. My flesh longs for you,
    in a dry and dreary land without water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, in the sanctuary I have watched you
    to see your power and your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because your mercy is better than life,
    my lips will worship you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I will bless you as long as I live.
In your name I will lift up my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul will be satisfied with rich food.
My mouth will praise you with lips filled with songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever I remember you on my bed,
throughout the watches of the night I meditate on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you are a help for me,
I sing for joy under the shade of your wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul clings to you.
Your right hand upholds me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But those who seek my life will go to destruction.
They will go into the depths of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be given over to the power of the sword.
They will become food for foxes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the king will rejoice in God.
All who swear by him will praise him,
but the mouths of those speaking lies will be shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my voice, O God, when I complain.
Protect my life from the terror caused by the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked,
from the noisy mob of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sharpen their tongues like a sword.
They shoot poison words like arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shoot at the innocent from hiding places.
Suddenly they shoot at him. They have no fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They strengthen each other in an evil plot.
They discuss where to hide snares.
They say, “Who will see them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They plot evil deeds and they say,
“We have come up with a perfect plot!”
The mind and heart of man are devious!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God will shoot them.
Suddenly they are wounded with an arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their own tongues cause their downfall.
Everyone who sees them will shake his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then all people will be afraid.
They will proclaim the work of God.
They will consider what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the righteous rejoice in the Lord
and take refuge in him.
Let all the upright in heart be confident!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise waits for you, O God, in Zion.
To you vows will be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who hear prayer, to you all mortals will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The record of my guilt overpowered me.
You atone for our rebellious acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the one you choose and bring near!
He will dwell in your courtyards.
We will be satisfied by the goodness of your house,
by the holiness of your temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In righteousness you answer us with awesome deeds,
    O God who saves us.
He is trusted by all the farthest ends of the earth and the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He establishes the mountains by his power.
He has wrapped himself with strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stills the roaring of the seas,
the roaring of their waves,
and the turmoil of the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those living at the ends of the earth fear your signs.
From sunrise to sunset you let them shout for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You visit the earth and water it.
You make it very rich.
God’s stream is filled with water.
You provide grain for them, just as you planned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You drench the land’s furrows. You flatten its plowed ground.
You soften it with showers. You bless its crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crown the year with your goodness.
The tracks made by your carts overflow with riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pastures of the wilderness drip.
The hills are wrapped with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The meadows are clothed with flocks.
The valleys are dressed with grain.
They shout for joy. Yes! They sing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shout praise to God, all the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make music to the glory of his name!
Make his praise glorious!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to God, “How awesome are your deeds!”
Because of your great power your enemies must cower before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the earth bows down to you.
They make music to you.
They make music to your name. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come and see the works of God.
How awesome his deeds for all people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the sea into dry land.
They crossed through the river on foot.
Let us rejoice in him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rules by his power forever.
His eyes watch the nations. Interlude
Do not let the rebellious rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless our God, you peoples.
Let the sound of his praise be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the one who has preserved our lives.
He did not let our feet slip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you tested us, God.
You refined us as silver is refined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You led us into a trap.
You laid a burden on our backs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You let men ride over our heads.
We went through fire and through water,
but you brought us out to a well-watered place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come to your house with whole burnt offerings.
I will fulfill my vows to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which my lips uttered,
    which my mouth spoke during my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will offer fat animals to you as whole burnt offerings,
    along with the smoke from rams. Interlude
I will offer cattle with goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, listen, all you who fear God,
and let me tell what he has done to save my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him I cried out with my mouth.
High praise was on my tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had contemplated evil in my heart,
the Lord would not have listened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but God has surely listened.
He has paid attention to the sound of my prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be God, who has not turned aside my prayer
or turned aside his mercy from me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God be gracious to us and bless us. Interlude
May his face shine on us—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that your way may be known on earth,
your salvation among all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the peoples praise you, O God.
May the peoples praise you—all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the countries be glad and sing for joy,
because you rule the peoples with fairness, Interlude
and you guide the countries of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the peoples praise you, O God.
May the peoples praise you—all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth will yield its harvest.
God, our God, will bless us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will bless us,
and all the ends of the earth will fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May God arise. May his enemies scatter.
May those who hate him flee from his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As smoke is blown away, may you blow them away.
As wax melts before the fire, may the wicked perish before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the righteous rejoice and celebrate in the presence of God.
They will be happy and joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God. Make music to his name.
Lift up a song to him who rides through the deserts.
His name is the Lord. Celebrate before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his holy dwelling, God is a father for the fatherless
and a judge who defends widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God causes the lonely to dwell together as a household.
He leads out the prisoners with music,
but the rebellious dwell in a scorched land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, when you went out in front of your people,
when you marched through the wasteland, Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the earth shook.
Yes, the heavens poured down rain,
    before God, this one from Sinai,
    before God, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You dispersed plentiful showers, O God.
You strengthened your inheritance when it was weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your people settled in it.
In your goodness you provided for the oppressed, O God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord provided the message.
The women who proclaimed it were a great army:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Kings with armies flee—they flee!”
The woman who stays home shares in the plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even while you lie among the campfires,
the wings of a dove are sheathed with silver,
and its feathers with yellow gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty scattered the kings there,
it snowed on Zalmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountain of Bashan is a mountain of God.
The mountain of Bashan is a mountain with many peaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O mountains with many peaks, why do you look jealously
    at the mountain God desires for his home?
Indeed, the Lord will dwell there forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The chariots of God are twice ten thousand,
thousands upon thousands.
Among them the Lord has come from Sinai into his sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You ascended on high. You led captivity captive.
You received gifts among men,
so that even among the rebellious the Lord God might dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord.
Day by day he bears our burdens.
He is the God who saves us. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our God is a God who saves.
From God the Lord comes escape from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God will crush the heads of his enemies,
the scalps of those who walk around in their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says, “I will bring them from Bashan.
I will bring them from the depths of the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that you may stomp your foot in blood.
The tongues of your dogs get their share of the enemies’ blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They see your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The singers lead the way.
After them come the musicians.
In the middle are virgins playing hand drums.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the assemblies bless God, the Lord,
    who is the Fountain of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is little Benjamin, leading them.
The officers of Judah are their noisy crowd.
There are the officers of Zebulun and the officers of Naphtali.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your God commands your strength.
Show strength, O God, as you have done for us before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of your temple at Jerusalem kings will bring tribute to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Threaten the beast among the reeds,
the herd of strong bulls among the calves (that is, the peoples),
    until they submit with bars of silver.
He scatters the peoples who delight in battles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Envoys will come from Egypt.
Cush will run to stretch out its hands to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth. Interlude
Make music to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to him who rides in the highest heavens,
    in the ancient heavens.
Yes, he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proclaim God’s strength.
His majesty is over Israel,
and his power is in the skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are awesome, O God, from your sanctuary.
The God of Israel, he is the one
    who gives power and strength to the people.
Blessed be God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. According to “Lilies.” By David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Save me, O God, for the waters have come up to my neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I sink into the deep mud, where there is no place to stand.
I have entered deep waters, and the rapids rush over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am worn out from my crying. My throat is sore.
My eyes are blurry, as I wait for my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate me without reason outnumber the hairs on my head.
Those who want to destroy me, my lying enemies, are strong.
I must repay things I did not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, you know my folly,
and my guilt is not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who place their confidence in you
    not be put to shame because of me,
    O Lord, the Lord of Armies.
May those who seek you not be disgraced because of me,
    O God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is for your sake that I bear scorn.
Shame covers my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become a stranger to my brothers,
a foreigner to my mother’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, zeal for your house consumes me.
The scorn of those who scorn you falls on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wept as I fasted,
but this only brought insults to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I wore sackcloth as my clothing,
I was a joke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who sit in the gatehouse gossip about me,
and the songs of the drunks are about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I direct my prayer to you, O Lord, for a time of favor.
God, in the greatness of your mercy,
    answer me with the certainty of salvation from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue me from the mud, so I do not sink.
Let me escape from those who hate me and from the deep waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the rapids rush over me.
Do not let the deep swallow me up.
Do not let the pit close its mouth over me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, Lord, for your mercy is good.
According to your great compassion, turn to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from your servant.
Because I am in distress, hurry, answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come near. Redeem my soul.
Ransom me because of my enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know my disgrace, my shame, and my confusion.
All my foes are in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Disgrace has broken my heart, and I am helpless.
I waited for sympathy, but there was none.
I waited for comforters, but I did not find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead they put bitter poison in my food.
For my thirst they gave me sour wine to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the table set before them become a snare.
May it be a trap to them and their allies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see.
Make their legs always tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on them.
Let the heat of your anger catch up with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May their camp be desolate.
May there be no one dwelling in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they pursue those you have disciplined, O God,
and they talk about the pain of those you wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add guilt to their guilt.
Do not let them enter into your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be erased from the book of life.
May they not be listed among the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am afflicted and in pain.
O God, may salvation from you set me on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will praise God’s name in song.
I will proclaim his greatness with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord this is better than an ox,
than a bull that has horns and hoofs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor will see and be glad.
You who seek God, may your hearts live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord listens to the needy,
and he does not despise the captives who belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let heaven and earth praise him,
the seas and all that move in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then the descendants of his servants will inherit it,
and those who love his name will dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hurry, God! Rescue me!
Lord, hurry to help me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who seek my life be put to shame and disgrace.
May all who desire to harm me be turned back and disgraced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May those who say, “Aha! We got you!” be dismayed,
because they have been put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.
May those who love your salvation always say, “Let God be exalted!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am oppressed and poor.
God, hurry to me. You are my help and my deliverer.
O Lord, do not delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In you, Lord, I have taken refuge.
May I not be put to shame forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your righteousness rescue me and deliver me.
Turn your ear to me and save me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be my rock and my refuge to which I can always go.
You give the command to save me,
because you are my high ridge and my stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, deliver me from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the unjust and the ruthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you have been my hope, Lord God,
my confidence since my youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have depended on you since I was in the womb.
You separated me from my mother’s body.
My praise to you is continuous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am like an evil omen to many,
but you are my strong refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth is filled with praise for you
and with your splendor all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not throw me away in old age.
As my strength fails, do not forsake me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my enemies speak against me,
and those who seek my life conspire together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “God has forsaken him.
Pursue him and seize him,
because there is no one to rescue him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, do not be far from me.
My God, hurry to help me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be ashamed.
Let my murderous accusers be consumed.
Let those who seek to harm me be covered
    with shame and disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I will always keep hoping.
I will keep adding to my praise for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mouth will tell about your righteousness,
about your salvation all day long,
although I do not know how to tell all about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will come and tell about your mighty deeds, Lord God.
I will commemorate your righteousness, yours alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, you have taught me since my youth,
and even now I still declare your marvelous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when I am old and gray, O God, do not forsake me,
till I declare the strength of your arm to the next generation,
your power to all who are to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your righteousness, God, reaches to the heights.
You have done great things.
God, who is like you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you who have made us see many troubles and disasters?
You will give us life again.
From the depths of the earth you will bring me up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will increase my greatness and comfort me once again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I will praise you, my God, for your faithfulness.
I will praise you with an instrument, with the harp.
I will make music to you with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lips will shout with joy when I make music to you.
Even my soul, which you have redeemed, will shout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, my tongue will tell of your righteousness all day long.
How ashamed, how disgraced they are—
    those who are trying to harm me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, give your authority to judge to the King.
Give your righteousness to the Son of the King.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will judge your people with righteousness.
He will judge your afflicted ones with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains will deliver peace to the people.
The hills will produce righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will obtain justice for the afflicted among the people.
He will save the children of the poor,
but he will crush the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will fear you as long as the sun remains,
and as long as the moon endures, through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will come down like rain on a mown field,
like showers, like a downpour on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days the righteous will flourish,
and peace will be plentiful till the moon is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will rule from sea to sea
and from the River to the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who dwell in the desert will bow before him,
and his enemies will lick the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of Tarshish and of the sea coasts will bring tribute.
The kings of Sheba and Seba will offer him gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All kings will bow down to him.
All nations will serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will certainly deliver the poor person who cries out,
as well as the afflicted, and the one who has no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will take pity on the weak and the poor.
He will save the lives of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From oppression and violence he will redeem their lives,
because their blood is precious in his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the King live!
May gold from Sheba be offered to him.
May people always pray for him.
May they bless him all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let there be an abundance of grain in the land.
Let it wave on the top of the mountains.
Let its fruit trees be like the cedars of Lebanon.
Let people from the city flourish like the grass of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May his name endure forever.
May his name flourish as long as the sun.
They will be blessed through him.
All nations will call him blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel,
    who alone does marvelous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be his glorious name forever.
May the whole earth be filled with his glory.
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This ends the prayers of David son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A psalm by Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely God is good to Israel, to the pure in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, my feet almost slipped out from under me.
I almost lost my footing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I even envied the arrogant when I observed the peace of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there are no struggles at their death.
Their bodies are sturdy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not have the trouble common to people.
They are not plagued along with the rest of mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore pride is their necklace.
They wear violence like clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their eyes bulge out of their fat.
The schemes of their hearts step over boundaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They mock. They speak maliciously.
From a high perch they threaten oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set their mouths against the heavens.
Their tongues strut around on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore God’s people turn to them,
and they drink it all in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “How can God know?
Does the Most High have knowledge?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, this is what the wicked are like—
secure forever, they increase in strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I really kept my heart pure for nothing?
Have I kept my hands clean in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been plagued all day.
My punishment comes every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had said, “I will speak like this,”
I would certainly have betrayed the circle of your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I tried to understand this, it was very troubling to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until I went to the sanctuary of God.
Then I understood their end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely you place them on slippery places.
You cause them to fall into destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How quickly they come to ruin,
completely destroyed by terrors!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are like a dream when someone wakes up.
So when you arise, O Lord,
you will despise them like an illusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, my heart was bitter,
and I was torn up inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was unthinking and ignorant.
I was a dumb animal before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am always with you.
You hold me by my right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your guidance you lead me,
and afterward, you will take me to glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who else is there for me in heaven?
And besides you, I desire no one else on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh and my heart fail,
but God is the rock of my heart and my portion forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No doubt about it!
Those who are far from you will perish.
You destroy all who commit adultery against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, God’s nearness is good for me.
I have made the Lord God my refuge,
so that I can tell about all your works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A maskil by Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you stay angry to the end, O God?
Why does your anger smoke against the flock in your pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember your community that you purchased long ago,
the tribe that you redeemed to be your possession.
Remember Mount Zion where you dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
March toward the perpetual ruins.
March against all the evil done by the enemy in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your foes roared in the middle of your appointed place.
They set up their battle standards as signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They looked like men swinging axes in a thicket of trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, they even chopped up all the carved paneling
    with their hatchets and hammers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They delivered your sanctuary to the fire.
They defiled the dwelling place for your Name
    by throwing it to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely!”
They burned all the appointed places of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We do not see any signs to guide us.
There is no longer a prophet,
and none of us knows how long this will go on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the foe scoff, O God?
Will the enemy insult your name forever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you hold back your hand, even your right hand?
Take it out of your pocket and finish them off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O God, are my king from long ago,
the one who works salvation right here on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who shattered the sea by your power.
You broke the heads of the great sea monsters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who crushed the heads of Leviathan.
You gave him as food to the people who live in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who opened up a spring and a seasonal stream.
You dried up the rivers that flow year-round.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The day belongs to you, and the night is also yours.
You set the moon and sun in place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was you who laid out all the boundaries of the earth.
Summer and winter—you shaped them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember this—the enemy scoffs, Lord,
and a foolish people has insulted your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not surrender the life of your turtledove to a wild animal.
Do not forget the life of your afflicted ones forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention to the covenant,
because dens of violence fill the dark places in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let the oppressed turn back in disgrace.
Let the poor and needy praise your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God, and prosecute your case.
Remember how the fools mocked you all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forget the sound of your foes,
the uproar of those who rise against you, which goes up continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We give thanks to you, O God, we give thanks.
Your wonderful deeds reveal that your name is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I choose the appointed time.
I am the one who judges rightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking.
I am the one who holds its pillars firm. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I say to the boasters, “Do not boast,”
and to the wicked, “Do not raise a horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not raise your horns to the heights.
Do not speak insolently with an outstretched neck.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, power to promote someone does not come
    from the east or from the west or from the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, it is God who makes the decision.
He brings down one. He raises up another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, a cup is in the hand of the Lord.
The wine foams. It is fully mixed.
He pours this out.
Yes, they drain its dregs.
All the wicked of the earth drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, I will proclaim this forever.
I will make music for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cut off all the horns of the wicked.
The horns of the righteous will be lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is known in Judah. In Israel his name is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His shelter is in Salem. His dwelling place is in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There he broke the flaming arrows, Interlude
the shield and the sword, and the weapons for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shine brightly as the Mighty One from the mountains full of prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The strong-hearted are plundered.
They have fallen into their final sleep.
Not one of the strong men can lift his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both chariot and horses sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are to be feared, yes, you.
Who can stand before you at the time of your wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From heaven you announced judgment.
The earth feared and was quiet
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when you rose up to judge, O God, Interlude
and to save all the afflicted of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the wrath of mankind will bring you praise.
You wear what remains of your wrath like a belt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make vows to the Lord your God and fulfill them.
Let all who are around him bring tribute to the one who is fearsome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He restrains the spirit of nobles.
He is fearsome against the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. According to Jeduthun. By Asaph. A psalm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With my voice to God—
with my voice I cried out to God,
and he listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day when I was distressed I sought the Lord.
At night my hand was stretched out,
and it never grew tired,
but my soul refused to be comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, I remembered and I groaned. Interlude
I pondered, and my spirit became weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You propped my eyelids open.
I was troubled but did not speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought about the days of long ago, the years long past.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
During the night I remembered my music.
With my heart I pondered, and my spirit asked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will the Lord reject forever?
Will he never again show favor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has his mercy vanished to the end?
Has what he said failed for all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has God forgotten to be gracious? Interlude
Has he really shut up his compassion in anger?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “This is what hurts me:
the change of the right hand of the Most High.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remember the deeds of the Lord.
Yes, I will remember your wonderful work from long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meditate on all your work,
and I will ponder all your deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O God, your way is carried out in holiness.
What god is as great as God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the God who performs a wonderful deed.
You made known your power among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With your arm you redeemed your people,
the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters saw you, O God.
The waters saw you and swirled.
Even the depths were turbulent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The clouds poured down water.
The skies echoed with thunder.
Indeed, your arrows shot back and forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of your thunder was heard in the tornado.
Lightning lit up the world.
The earth trembled and quaked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your route led through the sea.
Your trail went through the mighty waters,
but your footprints were not detected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear, O my people, to my instruction.
Turn your ear to the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will open my mouth to share a lesson.
I will speak about puzzling problems from long ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
