things we have heard and known,
things our fathers have told us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will not hide them from their descendants.
We will tell the next generation the praiseworthy deeds of the Lord,
his power, and the wonders that he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He set up testimony for Jacob.
In Israel he established the law.
He commanded our fathers to make it known to their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the next generation would know it,
even the children not yet born.
They would rise up and tell their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they would put their confidence in God,
and they would not forget the deeds of God,
but they would keep his commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they would not be like their fathers,
a stubborn, rebellious generation,
a generation that did not keep their hearts steadfast,
whose spirits were not faithful to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tribe of Ephraim, equipped and armed with bows,
    deserted on the day of battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not keep God’s covenant, and they refused to walk in his law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They forgot his deeds, the wonders he had shown to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the presence of their fathers he had performed a wonder,
in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split the sea and let them cross through it.
He made the water stand like a wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He led them with the cloud by day
and all through the night with light from the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He split the rocks in the wilderness,
and he let them drink water as plentiful as the deep sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought streams out of the rocky cliff.
He made water flow down like rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they continued to sin against him even more,
    by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tested God in their hearts by demanding food for their cravings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they spoke against God.
They said, “Is God able to set a table in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sure, he struck the rock and water flowed out,
and stream beds overflowed,
but can he really give us bread?
Can he really supply meat for his people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord heard, and he showed his anger.
Fire broke out against Jacob,
and his anger rose against Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they did not believe in God,
and they did not trust in his salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, he gave a command to the skies above,
and he opened the doors of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He rained down manna for them to eat,
and he gave them the grain of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each of them ate the bread of the mighty ones.
He sent them all the food they could eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent out the east wind from the heavens,
and he led out the south wind by his power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he rained meat down on them like dust,
and flying birds like sand on the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made the birds fall down inside their camp,
    all around their dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they ate until they had more than enough,
for he had brought them what they craved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They had not yet turned away from what they craved.
Their food was still in their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then God’s anger rose up against them.
He killed the strongest among them.
He cut down the best young men of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In spite of all this, they kept sinning,
and they did not believe in his wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he ended their days in frustration
and their years in terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever he struck them down, they would seek him.
Then they turned and sought God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they remembered that God was their Rock,
that God Most High was their Redeemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But then they would deceive him with their mouths,
and with their tongues they would lie to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their hearts were not committed to him,
and they were not faithful to his covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he was compassionate.
He atoned for their guilt and did not destroy them.
Many times he restrained his anger,
and he did not stir up his full wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He still remembered that they were only flesh,
like a wind that goes by and does not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness!
How often they grieved him in the wasteland!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They repeatedly put God to the test.
They provoked the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not remember the power of his hand—
the day when he redeemed them from the foe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he displayed his signs in Egypt
and his wonders in the region of Zoan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he turned their rivers to blood,
so they could not drink from their streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent against them a swarm of flies that bit them.
Then he sent frogs that destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he gave their crops to the grasshopper.
He gave what they worked for to the locust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He killed their grapevines with hail,
and their sycamore fig trees with sleet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he turned over their cattle to hail,
and their livestock to lightning bolts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent against them his burning anger,
his wrath and indignation and distress
    by sending destroying angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He prepared a path for his anger.
He did not spare their lives from death,
but he delivered their lives to the plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
the firstfruit of their virility in the tents of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he led his people out like sheep.
He led them like a flock through the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he guided them safely, so they were not afraid,
but the sea covered their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he brought them to the border of his holy land,
to this mountain which his right hand had taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He drove out nations before them.
He marked the boundaries of their inheritance,
and he settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they tested him.
They rebelled against God Most High,
and they did not keep his testimonies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, they turned aside and were treacherous like their fathers.
They were as undependable as a crooked bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they angered him with their high places,
and they made him jealous with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God heard, and he showed his anger.
He completely rejected Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he abandoned his dwelling in Shiloh,
the tent where he dwelled among people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he sent the symbol of his strength away into captivity.
He gave his splendor into the hand of the foe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also handed over his people to the sword,
and he showed his anger against his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire consumed their best young men,
so their virgins were not praised in wedding songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their priests fell by the sword,
and their widows did not weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord awoke like someone who has been sleeping,
like a warrior overcome by wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he drove back his foes.
He gave them everlasting shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he rejected the tent of Joseph,
and he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he chose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion, which he loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he built up his sanctuary like the heights,
like the world that he established for all time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he chose David his servant
and took him from the sheep pens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought him from following the mother sheep
    to shepherd his people Jacob
    and his possession Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he shepherded them with a sincere heart,
and with skillful hands he led them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, the nations have invaded your possession.
They have profaned your holy temple.
They have reduced Jerusalem to a heap of ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have left the corpses of your servants
    as food for the birds of the sky.
They have given the flesh of your favored ones to the wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have poured out their blood like water all over Jerusalem,
and there is no one to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are subjected to contempt by our neighbors,
to mockery and ridicule by those around us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will you stay angry forever?
How long will your jealous anger burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge you,
on the kingdoms that do not call on your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they have devoured Jacob,
and they have destroyed his pastureland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not charge the guilt of our fathers against us.
Hurry, let your compassion come to meet us,
for we are very weak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, who saves us, help us for the glory of your name.
Deliver us and make atonement for our sins for your name’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
Before our very eyes, display to the nations
    vengeance for the poured-out blood of your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the groaning of the prisoner come before you.
According to the great strength of your arm
    preserve those doomed to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay back into the laps of our neighbors seven times as much scorn
    as the scorn that they directed at you, Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we your people, the flock of your pasture, will praise you forever.
From generation to generation we will recount your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. To “Lilies.” A Testimony. By Asaph. A psalm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Shepherd of Israel, give ear,
you who lead Joseph like a flock.
You who are seated above the cherubim, shine forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh,
stir up your might.
Come with salvation for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, restore us, and make your face shine,
    so we will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord God of Armies, how long will your anger smoke
    against the prayer of your people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You make them eat bread with tears,
and you make them drink tears by the quart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You create strife between us and our neighbors,
so our enemies join together in mocking us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God of Armies, restore us, and make your face shine,
    so we will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You brought a vine out from Egypt.
You drove out the nations, and you planted it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You cleared a place for it,
and it took root and filled the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains were covered by its shade,
the cedars of God with its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It sent out its boughs to the Sea,
its shoots as far as the River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have you broken down its walls
so that all who pass by pick its fruit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wild boar from the forest tears it up,
and the wild animals feed on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God of Armies, return now!
Look down from heaven and see,
and take care of this vine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the shoot that your right hand has planted,
the son that you made strong for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is burned with fire like garbage.
Because of the rebuke from your face they perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your hand rest on the man at your right hand,
on the son of man whom you have made strong for yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then we will not turn away from you.
Cause us to live, and we will call on your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord God of Armies, restore us, and make your face shine,
    so we will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the choir director. According to gittith. By Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing a loud song to God, our strength.
Shout to the God of Jacob!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Begin the music, and play the hand drum.
Play the sweet-sounding lyre along with the harp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sound the ram’s horn at the new moon
and at the full moon for our festival day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, this is an order for Israel,
a regulation from the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God established it as a testimony for Joseph
when he went out against the land of Egypt.
There I heard a language I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says:
I relieved Israel’s shoulders from the burden.
His hands were set free from carrying buckets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In distress you called and I rescued you.
I answered you from the hiding place of thunder. Interlude
I tested you at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my people, and I will warn you.
If only you would listen to me, Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall be no foreign god among you!
You shall not bow down to a strange god.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord your God,
    who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my people would not listen to my voice,
and Israel was not willing to obey me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I sent them off in the stubbornness of their hearts.
They walked according to their own plans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only my people would listen to me,
if only Israel would walk in my ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would subdue their enemies quickly.
I would turn my hand against their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who hate the Lord would cower before him,
and their time of punishment would last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he would feed Israel with the best wheat.
With honey from the rock I would satisfy you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is standing in the assembly of God.
In the midst of the gods he renders judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you judge unjustly Interlude
and show favoritism to the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judge in favor of the weak and the fatherless.
Acquit the oppressed and the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rescue the weak and the needy.
Deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not know. They do not understand.
They walk around in darkness.
All the foundations of the earth are shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I myself said, “You are ‘gods,’
and you are all ‘sons of the Most High.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you will die like men.
You will fall like any other ruler.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O God. Judge the earth,
for you will take possession of all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, do not keep silent.
Do not be deaf. Do not be quiet, God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! Your enemies are in an uproar,
and those who hate you have raised their head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Against your people they devise deceptive schemes,
and they plot together against the people you treasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say, “Come, let us wipe them out as a nation,
so the name of Israel will not be remembered anymore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, with one mind they plot together.
They form an alliance against you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Moab and the Hagrites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even Ashshur has joined with them. Interlude
They have become the arm of the sons of Lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do to them as you did to Midian,
as you did to Sisera and Jabin at the stream Kishon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They perished at Endor.
They became like manure for the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make their nobles like Oreb and like Zeeb,
all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who said, “Let us take possession of God’s pastures for ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God, make them like tumbleweed,
like chaff before the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As fire burns the forest,
or as a flame sets the mountains on fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so pursue them with your violent wind,
and terrify them with your storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fill their faces with shame
so that they will seek your name, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May they be ashamed and terrified forever.
May they be disgraced and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them know that you, whose name is the Lord,
you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the choir director. According to gittith. By the Sons of Korah.
A psalm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How I love your dwelling place, O Lord of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul grows weak and even wastes away,
as I long for the courtyards of the Lord.
My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the sparrow has found a home,
and the swallow has found a nest for herself,
where she may place her young near your altars,
O Lord of Armies, my King and my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed are those who live in your house. Interlude
They are always praising you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is everyone whose strength is found in you.
The highways to Jerusalem are in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they pass through the Valley of Baca,
    it becomes full of springs.
The autumn rain also covers it with pools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They go from strength to strength.
Each one will appear before God in Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, God of Armies, hear my prayer. Interlude
Give ear, O God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look upon our Shield, O God.
Look with favor on the face of your Anointed One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather wait at the doorway of the house of my God
    than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is a sun and shield.
God gives grace and glory.
The Lord does not withhold any good thing
    from those who walk with integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord of Armies, how blessed is everyone who trusts in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You showed favor to your land, O Lord.
You restored Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You removed the guilt of your people. Interlude
You covered all their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You put away all your wrath.
You turned from your burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us, O God who saves us.
Put an end to your indignation with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you be angry with us forever?
Will you extend your anger through all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you not turn and revive us,
so that your people may rejoice in you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Show us your mercy, O Lord,
and give us your salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will hear what the true God, the Lord, will say.
He indeed speaks peace to his people, to his favored ones,
but do not let them turn to foolish ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely his salvation is near for those who fear him,
so that glory may dwell in our land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mercy and truth meet together.
Righteousness and peace kiss each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truth springs up from the earth,
and righteousness looks down from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will indeed give good things,
and our land will yield its harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness walks in front of him.
It prepares the way for his footsteps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your ear, O Lord.
Answer me, for I am poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Guard my life, for I am favored by you.
You are my God.
Save your servant, who trusts in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have mercy on me, O Lord,
for I call to you all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bring joy to the soul of your servant,
for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you, Lord, are good and forgiving
and abounding in mercy to all who call to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give ear to my prayer, O Lord.
Pay attention to the sound of my cries for mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the day of my distress I will call to you,
    because you will answer me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one like you among the gods, O Lord.
There are no deeds like your deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the nations you have made will come.
They will bow before you, O Lord,
and they will give glory to your name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you are great and do marvelous deeds.
You alone are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me your way, O Lord.
I will walk in your truth.
Give me wholehearted commitment to fear your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
and I will glorify your name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is your mercy toward me,
and you have delivered my soul from “the lowest hell.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God, the arrogant rise against me.
A mob of ruthless men seeks my life.
They pay no attention to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
slow to anger, abounding in mercy and faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn to me and have mercy on me.
Give your strength to your servant.
Save the son of your maidservant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give a sign of your goodness for me.
Then those who hate me will see it and be put to shame,
because you, Lord, have helped me and comforted me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city he founded is on the holy mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord loves the gates of Zion
    more than all the other dwellings of Jacob. Interlude
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Glorious things are spoken about you, O City of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will register Rahab and Babylon among those who know me.
Look! Philistia and Tyre are there, along with Cush!
Of them I say, “This one was born there in Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And about Zion it will be said,
“This one and that one were born in her,
and the Most High himself will establish her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he registers the peoples,
the Lord will write: Interlude
“This one was born there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the singers, as they dance, will sing,
“All my springs are in you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, the God who saves me, by day I cry out.
At night I cry before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my prayer come before you.
Turn your ear to my cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, my soul has had its fill of troubles,
and my life has arrived at the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am treated like those who go down to the pit.
I am like someone without strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am turned loose with the dead.
I am like the slain who lie in the grave,
like the ones you do not remember anymore,
like those who are cut off from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put me in the lowest pit,
in dark places, in the depths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrath presses against me. Interlude
You have battered me with all your breakers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have distanced my acquaintances from me.
You have made me repulsive to them.
I am shut in and I cannot get out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyesight grows dim from affliction.
I call to you, O Lord, every day.
I spread out my hands to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it for the dead that you do a miracle? Interlude
Do the spirits of the dead rise up and praise you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your mercy declared in the tomb,
your faithfulness in decay?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is your wonderful work known in the darkness?
Is your righteousness known in the land of forgetfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I cry to you, O Lord,
and in the morning my prayer comes before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why, O Lord, do you reject my soul?
Why do you hide your face from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been afflicted
and I have been close to death since my youth.
I have endured your terrors.
I am in despair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your rage has swept over me.
Your terrors have destroyed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long they surround me like water.
They have battered me completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have distanced my loved one and friend from me.
My only friend is darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing of the mercies of the Lord forever.
With my mouth I will make your faithfulness known
    through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, I have said, “Your mercy is built to last forever.
In the heavens you establish your faithfulness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said,
“I have made a covenant with my chosen one.
I have sworn to David my servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will establish your seed forever, Interlude
and I will build your throne through all generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens praise your wonders, O Lord,
also your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who in the skies can compare with the Lord?
Who is like the Lord among the sons of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is revered in the council of the holy ones.
He is to be feared more than all who surround him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord God of Armies, who is like you?
You are mighty, O Lord,
and your faithfulness surrounds you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You rule over the majestic sea.
When its waves rise up, you quiet them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You crushed Rahab like one of the slain.
With your strong arm you scattered your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens are yours, and yours also is the earth.
You founded the world and everything that fills it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You created the north and the south.
Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at your name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your arm works for you with power.
Your hand is strong. Your right hand is raised high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.
Mercy and truth are right in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed are the people who know the joyful cry.
Lord, they walk in the light from your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In your name they celebrate all day long.
In your righteousness they are lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you are the beauty of their strength,
and by your favor you exalt our Horn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, our Shield belongs to the Lord,
our King to the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once you spoke in a vision to your favored ones.
You said:
I have granted help to a warrior.
I have raised up a young man from among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I found David my servant.
With my holy oil I have anointed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the one whom my hand will sustain.
Surely my arm will strengthen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No enemy will subject him to tribute.
No violent man will oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will crush his foes before him
and strike down those who hate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My faithfulness and mercy will be with him,
and through my name his horn will be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will set his hand over the sea,
his right hand over the rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will call out to me, “You are my Father,
my God and the Rock that saves me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also make him the Firstborn,
the highest of the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will keep my mercy for him forever,
and my covenant with him will stand firm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will establish his seed forever.
His throne will endure like the days of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his sons forsake my law,
and they do not walk according to my judgments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if they violate my statutes and do not keep my commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish their rebellion with the rod, their guilt with whipping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I will not break off my mercy from him.
I will not let my truth become false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not violate my covenant.
I will not alter what comes out of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once and for all, I have sworn by my holiness—
surely I will not lie to David—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that his seed will continue forever,
and his throne will endure before me like the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be established forever like the moon. Interlude
This witness in the sky is faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have rejected, you have cast off,
you have been very angry with your anointed one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and you have renounced the covenant with your servant,
and you have thrown his crown on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have broken down all his walls
and reduced his fortresses to rubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass by on the road have plundered him.
He is despised by his neighbors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have raised up the right hand of his foes.
You have made all his enemies happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, you have deflected the edge of his sword,
and you have not let him stand up in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have put an end to his majesty,
and you have hurled his throne to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have cut short the days of his youth. Interlude
You have clothed him with shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord? Will you hide yourself forever?
Will your wrath burn like fire?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember me! What is my life!
For you have created such futility for all the children of Adam!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone live and not see death, Interlude
or save his life from the power of the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where are your former mercies, O Lord,
which you swore to David in your faithfulness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, Lord, the scorn your servants have endured.
(I carry on my heart all the many peoples!)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the scorn
    with which your enemies have been scornful, O Lord,
    with which they have scorned the steps of your Anointed One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord forever!
Amen and Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, you have been our dwelling place throughout all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were born,
before you gave birth to the earth and the world,
from eternity to eternity you are God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You grind people to dust,
and you say, “Return, children of Adam.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a thousand years in your sight are like a day,
like yesterday that has gone by,
or like a watch in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You sweep them away like a flood.
They are like sleep in the morning,
like grass which changes quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the morning it sprouts and grows.
By evening it is cut down, and it withers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, we are consumed by your anger,
and by your wrath we are terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have laid out our guilty deeds in front of you.
Our hidden sins are revealed in the light of your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all our days pass away under your fury.
We finish our years like a sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The days of our lives add up to seventy years,
or eighty years if we are strong.
Yet the best of them are trouble and sorrow,
for they disappear quickly, and we fly away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can understand the power of your anger?
But your fury is consistent with the fear that is owed to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach us to number our days in such a way
    that we bring a heart of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn, O Lord! How long!
Change your mind toward your servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Satisfy us in the morning with your mercy,
so that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
for as many years as we have seen trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your deeds be seen by your servants
and your majesty by their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the kindness of the Lord our God rest upon us.
Establish the work of our hands for us.
Yes, establish the work of our hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who lives in the shelter of the Most High
    will stay in the shadow of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will say to the Lord,
“My refuge and my fortress, my God in whom I trust.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely he will rescue you from the fowler’s trap,
from the destructive plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With his feathers he will cover you,
and under his wings you will find refuge.
His truth will be your shield and armor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will not fear the terror of night,
nor the arrow that flies by day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
nor the plague that prowls in the darkness,
nor the pestilence that destroys at noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A thousand may fall at your side,
ten thousand at your right hand,
but it will not come near you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will only observe it with your eyes.
You will see the punishment of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, you, Lord, are my refuge!
If you make the Most High your shelter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
evil will not overtake you.
Disaster will not come near your tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he will give a command to his angels concerning you,
    to guard you in all your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will lift you up in their hands,
so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will tread on the lion and the cobra.
You will trample the young lion and the serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says,
Because he clings to me, I will rescue him.
I will protect him, because he acknowledges my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will call on me, and I will answer him.
I will be with him in distress.
I will deliver him and I will honor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With long life I will satisfy him,
and I will let him see my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord,
to make music to your name, O Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to proclaim your mercy in the morning
and your faithfulness every night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with a ten-stringed instrument and with a harp,
with a melody on a lyre.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, you make me glad by your work, O Lord.
I sing loudly at the works of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How great are your works, O Lord.
Your thoughts are very deep!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The senseless man does not know,
and the fool does not understand this—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when the wicked spring up like weeds,
and all evildoers bloom like flowers,
they will be destroyed forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are exalted forever, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without a doubt your enemies, O Lord,
without a doubt your enemies will perish.
All evildoers will be scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have raised my horn like that of a wild ox.
I am drenched with fresh oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes have looked in triumph over my adversaries.
When evildoers rise against me, my ears hear their defeat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will shoot up like a palm tree.
They will grow tall like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Planted in the house of the Lord,
they will shoot up in the courtyards of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will still produce fruit in old age.
They will stay fresh and green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, they can proclaim, “The Lord is upright.
He is my Rock, and he does no wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns. He is clothed in majesty.
The Lord is clothed—he wears strength like a belt.
Yes, the world stands firm. It will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your throne was established long ago.
You are from eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waves have lifted up, O Lord,
the waves have lifted up their voice.
The waves roar loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mightier than the thundering of the great waters,
mightier than the breakers of the sea,
the Lord on high is mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your testimonies stand very firm.
Holiness beautifies your house for endless days, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rise up, O Judge of the earth.
Repay the proud with what they deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the wicked, O Lord,
how long will the wicked celebrate?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They gush. They speak arrogantly.
All the evildoers brag about themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They crush your people, O Lord.
They oppress the people that belong to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They kill the widow and the alien.
They murder the fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they say, “The Lord does not see.
The God of Jacob does not understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Understand, you brutes among the people.
You fools, when will you become wise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who planted the ear—will he not hear?
The one who formed the eye—will he not observe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who disciplines nations—will he not rebuke them?
He is the one who teaches mankind knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord knows the thoughts of mankind.
He knows that they are just vapor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the person whom you discipline, O Lord,
whom you teach from your law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You grant him rest in days of trouble,
until a pit is dug for the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not desert his people,
and he will never forsake those who are his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then judgment will again be based on righteousness,
and all the upright in heart will pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
Who will take a stand for me against evildoers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unless the Lord had been my helper,
my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I said, “My foot has slipped,”
your mercy, Lord, upheld me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my worries within me were many,
your comfort brought joy to my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a destructive throne be allied with you,
one that creates injustice by its decrees?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They band together against the life of the righteous,
and they condemn innocent blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord has become my fortress,
and my God is the rock where I take refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he will repay them for their iniquity,
and he will destroy them for their wickedness.
The Lord our God will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us sing joyfully to the Lord.
Let us give a loud shout to the Rock who saves us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us approach his presence with thanksgiving.
With music we will shout to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is the great God
and the great King above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He holds the unexplored places of the earth in his hand,
and the peaks of the mountains belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sea belongs to him, for he made it,
and his hands formed the dry land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us bow down. Let us revere him.
Let us kneel before the Lord our Maker,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he is our God,
and we are the people of his pasture
and the flock in his hand.
Today, if you hear his voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
do not harden your hearts as they did at Meribah,
as they did that day at Massah in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where your fathers challenged me
and tested me though they had seen what I had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For forty years I was disgusted with that generation,
and I said, “They are a people who have hearts that stray.
They do not acknowledge my ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I swore in my anger,
“They shall never enter my resting place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song.
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord. Praise his name.
Proclaim the good news of his salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell about his glory among the nations,
about his marvelous deeds among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord and worthy of great praise.
He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are “nothings,”
but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendor and majesty are before him.
Power and beauty are in his sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord, families of peoples,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due his name.
Bring a gift and come into his courtyards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bow down to the Lord in the splendor of his holiness.
Look away from his face, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say among the nations, “The Lord reigns.”
The world is firmly established.
It will not be moved.
He will judge the peoples with fairness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens rejoice.
Let the earth celebrate.
Let the sea roar,
and all that fills it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the fields be overjoyed,
and everything that is in them.
Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
before the Lord, for he comes,
    for he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness
and the peoples in his faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns. Let the earth celebrate.
Let the many islands and coastlands rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clouds and deep darkness surround him.
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire goes out in front of him.
It burns up his foes all around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His lightning lights up the world.
The earth sees and writhes in pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains melt like wax
    in the presence of the Lord,
    in the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens proclaim his righteousness,
and all the peoples see his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who serve idols are put to shame,
those who boast in “nothings.”
Bow to him, all you gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zion hears and rejoices,
and the daughters of Judah celebrate
    because of your judgments, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For you, O Lord, are the Most High over all the earth.
You are raised up far above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let those who love the Lord hate evil.
He guards the lives of his favored ones.
He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Light rises for the righteous
and joy for the upright in heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous,
and give thanks as you remember his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord a new song,
for he has done marvelous things.
His right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made his salvation known.
He has revealed his righteousness to the eyes of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has remembered his mercy and his faithfulness
    to the house of Israel.
All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shout for joy to the Lord, all the earth.
Break out in joyful song! Make music!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make music to the Lord with the lyre,
with the lyre and the sound of music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With trumpets and the sound of the ram’s horn
    shout for joy before the King, the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea roar, and everything that fills it,
the world, and all who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the rivers clap their hands.
Let the mountains sing for joy together before the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness
and the peoples with fairness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord reigns. Let the peoples tremble.
He is seated above the cherubim. Let the earth quake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is great in Zion. He is exalted over all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them praise your name, great and awesome.
He is holy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The King is mighty. He loves justice.
You, Lord, have established fairness.
In Jacob you carried out justice and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt the Lord our God and bow down before his footstool.
He is holy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses and Aaron were among his priests.
Samuel was among those who call on his name.
They called on the Lord, and he answered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From within the pillar of cloud he spoke to them.
They kept his testimonies and the order that he gave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord our God, you answered them.
For them you were a God who removes sin,
but you repaid them for their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt the Lord our God,
and bow down before his holy mountain,
because the Lord our God is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shout to the Lord with joy, all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Serve the Lord with gladness.
Come before him with joyful songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know that the Lord is God.
He made us, and we are his.
We are his people, the sheep of his pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Enter his gates with thanksgiving,
his courtyards with praise.
Give thanks to him and bless his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is good. His mercy endures forever.
His faithfulness continues through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing about your mercy and justice.
To you, O Lord, I will make music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will act wisely, following the way that is honest.
When will you come to me?
Within my palace I will conduct myself with integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not tolerate an evil cause in my sight.
I hate unfaithfulness and apostasy.
It will not stick to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverted heart shall be kept far from me.
I will not acknowledge evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will silence anyone who slanders his neighbor in secret.
I cannot tolerate anyone who has arrogant eyes and a proud heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes will watch for the faithful in the land,
so that they can be seated with me.
Those who walk in the way of integrity will serve as my ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anyone who practices deceit will not sit inside my palace.
Anyone who is a liar will not stand in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every morning I will silence all the wicked in the land,
in order to cut off every evildoer from the city of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not hide your face from me on the day when I am distressed.
Turn your ear to me on the day I call.
Hurry! Answer me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my days go up in smoke,
and my bones are burned like hot coals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is cut down and withered like grass,
so I forget to eat my food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the sound of my groaning, my bones stick out of my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am like an owl in the wilderness,
like a screech owl among the ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lie awake.
I have become like a lonely bird on a roof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long my enemies taunt me.
Those who ridicule me use my name as a curse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I eat ashes like bread,
and I mix tears with my drinks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of your rage and your wrath,
    you have picked me up and thrown me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are being stretched out like a shadow,
and I am dried up like grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, sit on your throne forever,
and you will be remembered through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will rise and have compassion on Zion.
Yes, it is time to be gracious to her,
because the appointed time has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, your servants will show favor to her stones,
and they will have compassion on her dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the nations will fear the name of the Lord,
and all the kings of the earth will fear your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will rebuild Zion.
He will appear in his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will respond to the prayer of the naked.
He will not despise their prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let this be written till the last generation,
so that a people not yet created may praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord looked down from his high, holy place.
From heaven he viewed the earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
    to release those condemned to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the name of the Lord will be recorded in Zion
and his praise in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when the peoples and the kingdoms are gathered together
    to serve the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took away my strength during my lifetime.
He cut short my days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of my days.”
Your years go on through all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago you laid a foundation for the earth,
and the heavens are the work of your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will perish, but you remain.
All of them wear out like a garment.
Like clothing you will change them,
and they will be changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you are the same,
and your years will never end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of your servants will dwell with you,
and their descendants will be established before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
All that is within me, bless his holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
and do not forget all his benefits—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who pardons all your guilt,
who heals all your diseases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who redeems your life from the pit,
who crowns you with mercy and compassion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who satisfies your life with goodness,
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord performs righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made known his ways to Moses,
his deeds to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger, abounding in mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not always accuse.
He will not keep his anger forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not treat us as our sins deserve.
He does not repay us according to our guilty deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, as high as the heavens are above the earth,
    so powerful is his mercy toward those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As distant as the east is from the west,
    so far has he removed our rebellious acts from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a father has compassion on his children,
    so the Lord has compassion on those who fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he knows how we were formed.
He remembers that we are dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for man, his days are like grass.
Like a wildflower he blossoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the wind blows over it, and it is gone,
and its place recognizes it no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord’s mercy is from eternity to eternity
    over those who fear him,
and his righteousness is with their children’s children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
with those who keep his covenant,
    with those who remember his precepts in order to obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has established his throne in the heavens,
and his royal power rules over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, you his angels,
you strong warriors who obey his word
    by listening to what he says.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, all his armies,
you who minister to him,
you who do whatever pleases him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, everything he has made
    in all places where he rules.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
O Lord my God, you are very great.
You are clothed with splendor and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He wears light like a robe.
He stretches out the heavens like a canopy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lays beams on the waters to support his upper chambers.
He makes clouds his chariot.
He travels on the wings of the wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes his messengers winds.
His ministers are blazing fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He placed the earth firmly on its foundations.
It cannot be moved forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You covered it with the deep as a garment.
The waters stood above the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At your rebuke they fled.
At the sound of your thunder they hurried away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters surged up the mountains.
They went down into the valleys,
to the place that you prepared for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You set a boundary that they cannot cross.
They will not return to cover the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes springs flow into streams
    that run between the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They give water to every wild animal.
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The birds of the sky live by the streams.
From among the branches they send out their song.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He waters the mountains from his upper chambers.
The earth is filled with the fruit he produces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes grass grow for the cattle,
and plants that people use to produce food from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also wine that makes people’s hearts glad,
olive oil to make their face shine,
and bread that sustains their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The trees of the Lord have everything they need.
He planted the cedars of Lebanon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where birds make their nests.
The stork has its home in the fir trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats.
The crags are a refuge for the rock badgers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The moon marks off the months and seasons.
The sun knows when to go down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You bring darkness, and it becomes night.
During it all the animals in the forest move about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young lions roar for their prey.
They are seeking their food from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun rises, and they gather together.
They return to their dens and lie down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man goes out to his work.
He continues his labor until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are your works, O Lord!
In wisdom you made them all.
The earth is full of your creatures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Here is the sea, great and very wide.
In it creatures swarm beyond number—
living things, the small with the large.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the ships go back and forth,
and the leviathan that you formed to play in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them wait hopefully for you to give them their food in its time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give it to them. They gather it up.
You open your hand. They are satisfied with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You hide your face. They are terrified.
You take away their breath.
They breathe their last and return to their dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You send your Spirit—they are created.
You renew the face of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever.
May the Lord rejoice in his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looks at the earth and it trembles.
He touches the mountains and they smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will sing to the Lord throughout my life.
I will make music to my God as long as I last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May my meditation be pleasing to him.
I will rejoice in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May sinners come to an end on the earth,
and the wicked—may they be no more.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord.
Proclaim his name.
Make his deeds known among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him, make music to him.
Meditate on all his wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take pride in his holy name.
Let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Search for the Lord and his strength.
Seek his face always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the wonders which he has done,
his signs, and the judgments from his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you descendants of Abraham his servant,
you sons of Jacob, his chosen ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God.
His judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembers his covenant forever,
the word he commanded for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the covenant which he made with Abraham,
and his oath to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
the territory you will possess.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While they were few in number,
just a little group and aliens in the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they moved around from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He did not allow anyone to oppress them,
and he rebuked kings because of them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do not touch my anointed ones,
and do not harm my prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he summoned a famine on the land.
He destroyed their entire food supply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent ahead of them a man sold as a slave, Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They hurt his feet with chains.
His throat was clamped in an iron collar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until the time when his predictions came true.
The promise of the Lord tested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king sent for him and released him.
The ruler of peoples set him free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He made him master of his house
and ruler over all his possessions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bind his officials by his will,
to teach his elders wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel came to Egypt.
Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord made his people very fruitful.
He made them too numerous for their foes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the Egyptians’ hearts so they hated his people.
They dealt deceitfully with his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent Moses his servant,
and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They performed his signs among them,
his warning signs in the land of Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent darkness, and it became extremely dark,
because Israel did not rebel against his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned their waters into blood,
and he caused their fish to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land swarmed with frogs,
even in the rooms of their kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and a swarm of flies came.
There were lice throughout their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them hail instead of rain,
with blazing lightning throughout their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he struck down their vines and fig trees,
and he broke down the trees within their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spoke, and the locusts came,
and grasshoppers without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ate every green plant in their land.
They ate the produce of their soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he struck down all the firstborn in their land,
the first fruit of all their virility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he brought Israel out with silver and gold.
From among their tribes no one stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was glad when they went out,
because fear of Israel had fallen on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He spread out a cloud as a canopy
and fire to give light at night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They asked, and he brought quail,
and he satisfied them with bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opened the rock, and water gushed out.
It flowed in the desert like a river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he remembered his holy word to Abraham, his servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he brought out his people with rejoicing,
his chosen ones with a joyful shout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He gave them the lands of the nations,
and they took possession of the work of other peoples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that they could keep his statutes and observe his laws.
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise the Lord.
Give thanks to the Lord,
for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can tell about the mighty deeds of the Lord?
Who can cause all his praise to be heard?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed are those who defend justice,
who do what is right all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember me, O Lord,
when you show favor to your people.
Visit me with your salvation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that I may experience the good that belongs to your chosen ones,
so that I may rejoice in the joy of your nation,
so that I may join in praise with the people that belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have sinned along with our fathers.
We have become guilty. We have acted wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our fathers in Egypt did not reflect on your wonders.
They did not remember your abundant mercies,
so they rebelled beside the sea, by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless, he saved them for his name’s sake,
    to make his might known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up.
He caused them to go through the deep sea as if it were a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He saved them from the hand of the one who hated them.
He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the waters covered their foes.
Not one of them remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they believed his words. They sang his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They quickly forgot his deeds.
They did not wait for his plan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they were filled with craving in the wilderness,
they challenged God in the wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he gave them what they asked for,
but he made them sick so they wasted away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they grew jealous of Moses in the camp
and of Aaron, who was holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan,
and it closed over the followers of Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then fire burned up their followers.
Flames consumed the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made a calf at Horeb,
and they bowed down to a thing cast from metal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they exchanged their Glory for a model of an ox that eats grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They forgot the God who saved them
    by doing great things in Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
wonders in the land of Ham,
    awesome deeds beside the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he said he would destroy them.
But Moses, his chosen one, stood between God and the people
    to turn aside his wrath, so it did not destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they refused the pleasant land.
They did not believe his word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grumbled in their tents.
They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he lifted up his hand and swore to them
    that he would make them fall in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and make their descendants fall among the nations,
    and he would scatter them throughout the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor,
and they ate sacrifices offered to dead gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They provoked the Lord by their actions,
and a plague broke out among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Phinehas stood up and interceded for them,
and the plague was restrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So this was credited to him as righteousness
for generation after generation, to eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again by the waters of Meribah they provoked the Lord,
and trouble came on Moses because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they rebelled against his Spirit,
Moses spoke recklessly with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not destroy the peoples
as the Lord had commanded them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but they mixed with the nations,
and they learned to do what the nations did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They also served their idols,
and the idols became a snare for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also sacrificed their sons and daughters to demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan.
So the land was polluted by their children’s blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and they made themselves unclean by what they did.
They prostituted themselves by their actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the Lord burned with anger against his people,
and he loathed the people who belonged to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he handed them over to the nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then their enemies oppressed them,
and they had to submit to their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many times he delivered them,
but they deliberately rebelled,
and they sank down in their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he looked on them in their distress when he heard their outcry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So for their sake he remembered his covenant.
Because of his great mercy, he changed his course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he caused all their captors to have pity on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from the nations,
so that we may give thanks to your holy name and praise you confidently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity,
and all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good,
for his mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the redeemed of the Lord say this,
those he redeemed from the hand of the foe,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They wandered in the wilderness, in the wasteland.
They did not find the way to a city where they could live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were hungry and also thirsty,
so their lives were draining away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He delivered them from their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He led them by a straight way to come to a city where they could live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he satisfies the desire of the thirsty,
and he fills the desire of the hungry with good things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were sitting in darkness and the shadow of death,
prisoners, bound in misery and chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they had rebelled against the words of God,
and they despised the plan of the Most High.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he broke their hearts with hard labor.
They stumbled, and there was no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He saved them from their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
and he tore off their chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he shatters bronze doors,
and he cuts through iron bars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They became fools through their rebellious way,
and they brought affliction on themselves by their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lost their appetite for food,
    so they approached the gates of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He saved them from their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sent his word and healed them.
He rescued them from the pits that trapped them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so let them sacrifice thank offerings
and tell about his works with a joyful shout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They went down to the sea in ships.
They conducted trade on many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They saw the deeds of the Lord
and his wonders on the deep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he spoke and stirred up a violent storm,
    which produced large waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were raised up to the sky.
They sank down into the depths.
In their danger their courage melted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They reeled and staggered like a drunk.
All their skill disappeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their distress.
He brought them out of their troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He calmed the storm. Its waves were hushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were glad when it grew quiet,
and he guided them to the port they desired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord
for his mercy and his wonderful deeds for all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
and praise him in the session of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned rivers into a wilderness
and flowing springs into thirsty ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned fruitful land into a salt waste,
because of the wickedness of those who lived in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He turned the wilderness into pools of water
and the desert into flowing springs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he let the hungry live there,
and they founded a city where they could live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they sowed fields, and they planted vineyards,
    which produced abundant fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he blessed them, so they increased greatly in number.
He did not let their herds of cattle decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But then their numbers decreased,
and they were humbled by oppression, disaster, and sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who pours contempt on nobles made them wander in confusion
    where there was no road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he lifted up the needy out of affliction
and made their families like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The upright see and rejoice,
but all wickedness shuts its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is wise, let him keep these things.
